DOC.brief_title: Adductor Canal Block Versus Femoral Nerve Block Analgesia After Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction Arthroscopically
DOC.detailed_description: Forty patient American Society Anesthesiologists（ASA） Ⅰ-Ⅲ（no limitation age gender）are randomize receive either continuous adductor canal block ( ACB ) femoral nerve block ( FNB ) via catheter ( continuous infusion 0.2 % ropivacaine , 5 mL/h 48 hour ) PACU immediately anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction arthroscopically . Patients general anesthesia operation receive femoral nerve block 0.25 % ropivacaine 10ml surgery.Both group receive postoperatively IV patient control analgesia ( PCA ) morphine ( bolus 0.8mg , lock-out time 15 minute , background infusion 2ml/h ) beside continuous nerve block . Patients go visited follow-up day surgery follow two day . Quadriceps strength assess displacement patella.VAS rest time、degree knee flexion、VAS 45°flexion knee、dose opioids、whether patient sleep disturbance also record .
